ygData.subject: RE: Re: Re: Finding HGs (and cash) (medium long)
ygData.msgSnippet: Aye.  Didn t want to get too techy-feely.  This can be non-trivial to fix depending upon how the code is implemented, especially in Windows. I suppose I m
ygData.messageBody:
Aye. Didn't want to get too techy-feely. This can be non-trivial to fix
depending upon how the code is implemented, especially in Windows.

I suppose I'm exploiting a known client-side bug. Fortunately from the
server side they can't tell this from me simply holding the keys down
indefinitely so I'm not likely to get a warning from a GM. ;-)

Crier

> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Fri, 17 Dec 1999, JasonF wrote:
> >
> > Hit FORWARD (or BACKWARD), ENTER to open a chat window while
> holding your
> > FORWARD down, then release your FORWARD key you will stick
> moving forward.
> > Now hit ENTER again to close the chat text box without sending
> anything. In
>
> Heh - I just fixed this bug in the program I'm working on. :-)
>
> (keyup/mousebuttonup not being processed if it happens outside
> the scope of the original keydown/mousebuttondown.)
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
